required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Trazodone & Cognitive Behavioral Therapy to Treat Insomnia
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Trazodone vs. Cognitive Behavioral Therapy in Patients With Chronic Insomnia Associated With Objective Short Sleep Duration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of a 3 month medication trial of Trazodone versus 3 months of Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) in patients with chronic insomnia.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants with chronic insomnia associated with objective short sleep duration will be recruited to participate in a 3 month clinical trial on the efficacy of trazodone versus CBT, with a 6 month follow up. The primary outcome measure will be objective sleep duration as measured by both actigraphy and polysomnography. The secondary outcome measure will be subjective severity of sleep disturbance.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Objective Polysomnography Sleep Duration From Baseline to Post Treatment (3 Months)
primary_outcome.description: Polysomnography (8 hours fixed time in bed) will be used to measure sleep duration at baseline and post treatment (3 months)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Objective Polysomnography Sleep Duration From Baseline to Follow up (9 Months)
primary_outcome.description: Polysomnography (8 hours fixed time in bed) will be used to measure sleep duration at baseline and follow up (9 months)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Objective Actigraphy Sleep Duration From Baseline to Post Treatment (3 Months)
primary_outcome.description: Actigraphy (ad libitum time in bed) will be used to measure sleep duration at baseline and Post Treatment (3 months)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Objective Actigraphy Sleep Duration From Baseline to Follow up (9 Months)
primary_outcome.description: Actigraphy (ad libitum time in bed) will be used to measure sleep duration at baseline and follow up (9 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Subjective Severity of Sleep Disturbance at 3 Months
secondary_outcome.description: The Insomnia Severity Index (ISI) was used to measure the change in severity of sleep disturbance at baseline to post treatment (3 months). The ISI is composed of 7 items each rated on a scale of 0-4. The total score was calculated by adding the individual item scores. The total ISI scale score ranged from 0-28 with higher total scores indicating a higher severity of insomnia symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Subjective Severity of Sleep Disturbance at 9 Months
secondary_outcome.description: The Insomnia Severity Index (ISI) was used to measure the change in severity of sleep disturbance at baseline to Follow Up (9 months). The ISI is composed of 7 items each rated on a scale of 0-4. The total score was calculated by adding the individual item scores. The total ISI scale score ranged from 0-28 with higher total scores indicating a higher severity of insomnia symptoms.

intervention.description: 50 mg once a day, for 3 months
The CBT Protocol is implemented over a period of 12 weeks, with 4 consultations held on a weekly basis and 4 held on a biweekly basis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic insomnia with duration of more than 1 year
- Objective short sleep duration (< 6 hours)
- BMI < 39
- Ages 30-60
- Men & Women
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major Mental Illness
- Substance Abuse/Dependence
- Sleep Apnea
- Periodic Limb Movement Disorder
- Shift Work or circadian disorders
- Diabetes
- Chronic Renal Failure, Hepatic Insufficiency, Chronic Heart Failure
- Current Use of hypnotics or sleep inducing sedative antidepressants

overall_official.affiliation: Penn State College of Medicine, Penn State Milton S. Hershey Medical Center

facility.name: Penn State College of Medicine, Penn State Milton S. Hershey Medical Center

Vgontzas AN, Liao D, Bixler EO, Chrousos GP, Vela-Bueno A. Insomnia with objective short sleep duration is associated with a high risk for hypertension. Sleep. 2009 Apr;32(4):491-7.

Vgontzas AN, Bixler EO, Lin HM, Prolo P, Mastorakos G, Vela-Bueno A, Kales A, Chrousos GP. Chronic insomnia is associated with nyctohemeral activation of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis: clinical implications. J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 2001 Aug;86(8):3787-94.

Fernandez-Mendoza J, Calhoun S, Bixler EO, Pejovic S, Karataraki M, Liao D, Vela-Bueno A, Ramos-Platon MJ, Sauder KA, Vgontzas AN. Insomnia with objective short sleep duration is associated with deficits in neuropsychological performance: a general population study. Sleep. 2010 Apr;33(4):459-65.

Fernandez-Mendoza J, Calhoun SL, Bixler EO, Karataraki M, Liao D, Vela-Bueno A, Jose Ramos-Platon M, Sauder KA, Basta M, Vgontzas AN. group.title: Trazodone
group.description: Trazodone: 50 mg once a day, for 3 months

group.title: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy
group.description: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy: The CBT Protocol is implemented over a period of 12 weeks, with 4 consultations held on a weekly basis and 4 held on a biweekly basis.

group.description: Trazodone: 50 mg once a day, for 3 months

group.title: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy
group.description: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy: The CBT Protocol is implemented over a period of 12 weeks, with 4 consultations held on a weekly basis and 4 held on a biweekly basis.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Insomnia Severity Index
measure.description: The Insomnia Severity Index (ISI) a self completed questionnaire was used to measure the severity of sleep disturbance. The ISI is composed of 7 items each rated on a scale of 0-4. The total score was calculated by adding the individual item scores. The total ISI Scale can range from 0-28 with higher total scores indicating a higher severity of insomnia symptoms and sleep disturbance.

outcome.title: Change in Objective Polysomnography Sleep Duration From Baseline to Post Treatment (3 Months)
outcome.description: Polysomnography (8 hours fixed time in bed) will be used to measure sleep duration at baseline and post treatment (3 months)
outcome.population: Objective Short Sleepers defined by 2 week actigraphy sleep duration measurement

group.description: Trazodone: 50 mg once a day, for 3 months

group.title: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy
group.description: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy: The CBT Protocol is implemented over a period of 12 weeks, with 4 consultations held on a weekly basis and 4 held on a biweekly basis.

measure.title: Change in Objective Polysomnography Sleep Duration From Baseline to Post Treatment (3 Months)

outcome.title: Change in Objective Polysomnography Sleep Duration From Baseline to Follow up (9 Months)
outcome.description: Polysomnography (8 hours fixed time in bed) will be used to measure sleep duration at baseline and follow up (9 months)
outcome.population: From the 21 participants who completed the study, 15 met the criteria for objective short sleep duration and were included in the final analysis.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Subjective Severity of Sleep Disturbance at 3 Months
outcome.description: The Insomnia Severity Index (ISI) was used to measure the change in severity of sleep disturbance at baseline to post treatment (3 months). The ISI is composed of 7 items each rated on a scale of 0-4. The total score was calculated by adding the individual item scores. The total ISI scale score ranged from 0-28 with higher total scores indicating a higher severity of insomnia symptoms.
outcome.population: From the 21 participants who completed the study, 15 met the criteria for objective short sleep duration and were included in the final analysis.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
